title: For 40 Years, Maine County Helps Families Build Successful Healthy Habits
teaser: Offering classes on healthy cooking for low-income residents is just one of the ways that Franklin County, Maine, has beaten the odds on cardiovascular disease for this aging, rural population. A recent article in "The Journal of the American Medical Association" highlighted the county health system's unique efforts that span more than four decades.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
